subject: Productivity
title: Thinking in Bets
description: A quick win: understand Thinking in Bets.

hook.text: Annie Duke was a professional poker player. She learned that every decision is a bet on an uncertain future.

buildup.text: In her book, Duke argues that decision quality and outcome quality are different. Good bets can lose.

discovery.text: Resulting â€” judging decisions by outcomes â€” is a trap. A bad decision can get lucky. A good one can fail.

twist.text: Assigning probabilities instead of certainties improves thinking. I'm 70% sure beats I know this will work.

climax.text: Strategic thinkers evaluate decision processes, not just results. They improve the odds, then accept the variance.

punchline.text: Good decisions sometimes lose. Bad ones sometimes win. Trust the process.

quiz.question: What is resulting according to Annie Duke?
options: Judging decisions by outcomes instead of process quality
